section: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The phrase "In Addition to The Total Contributions" is ambiguous because it is unclear whether the 10% of generated gross revenue is meant to be in addition to the initial $60,000 contribution or in addition to the total of all contributions made by JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go over the life of the joint venture. This lack of clarity could lead to disputes over the financial obligations of JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go.

section: JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD To be paid within 90 days of signing this agreement. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract, In Addition to The Total Contributions.
explanation: The clause "Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue From Awarded Contract" lacks specific details regarding the contracts that would trigger this revenue sharing. It is not defined what constitutes an "Awarded Contract." It also does not specify when this 10% is to be paid (monthly, quarterly, annually) and how the gross revenue is to be calculated. The term of time is not defined either.

section: Member Contribution Description BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: There is a misalignment in the Capital Contributions section. BorrowMoney.com, inc is contributing 1,500 square feet of leased office space and JVLS, LLC is contributing $60,000 in cash plus 10% of gross revenue. However, both contributions are valued at $3,500,000 USD. This is extremely unlikely. It is highly implausible that $60,000 in cash plus 10% of gross revenue would have the same value as 1,500 square feet of office space, indicating a possible error in the valuation.

section: Member Contribution Description BorrowMoney.com, inc 1, 500 square feet of Leased/rent office Space Includingspecified Description of duty* $3,500,000.00 USD JVLS, LLC dba Vaccines 2Go $60,000.00 USD in cash. Plus (10%) Of Any Generated Gross Revenue, In Add i t i on to The To ta l Contributions. $3,500,000.00 USD
explanation: The description for BorrowMoney.com, inc's contribution includes "Includingspecified Description of duty*." This is incomplete and does not provide a clear description of the duties associated with the office space. The asterisk suggests a footnote or further explanation, but none is provided, leading to ambiguity.

section: Where a Member is in breach of this Agreement and that Member has not remedied the breach on notice from the Venture and after a reasonable period then the remaining Members will have the right to terminate this Agreement with regard to that individual defaulting Member (an "Involuntary Withdrawal") and take whatever action necessary to protect the interests of the Venture.
explanation: The phrase "reasonable period" is vague. The contract provides no specific timeframe defining "reasonable period" for remedying a breach after notice. The term is subjective and may be interpreted differently by the members, potentially leading to disputes. A specific number of days (e.g., 30 days) would provide greater clarity and enforceability.

section: In the absence of a written agreement setting a value, the value of the Venture will be determined based on the total revenue generated over the last 3 months. An appraiser will be appointed within a reasonable period of the date of withdrawal or dissolution. The results of the appraisal will be binding on all Members. A withdrawing Member's interest will be based on the proportion of their respective capital account less any outstanding liabilities a Member may have to the Venture. The intent of this section is to ensure the survival of the Venture despite the withdrawal of any individual Member.
explanation: The phrase "reasonable period" is vague. The contract provides no specific timeframe defining "reasonable period" for the appointment of an appraiser. This subjective term may be interpreted differently by the members, potentially leading to disputes.
